intro: Stenaria nigricans var. nigricans, commonly known as the black-stemmed stenaria, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries such as Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit, lance-shaped leaves, and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Its botanical features make it a desirable ornamental plant in gardens and greenhouses.
